title: U.S.-Japan Joint Statement on Advancing a Free and Open Indo-Pacific Through Energy, Infrastructure and Digital Connectivity Cooperation – The White House
content:
Statements & Releases			

		Infrastructure & Technology	

Issued on:
November 13, 2018
The United States and Japan reaffirmed their shared goal of bolstering a free and open Indo-Pacific and welcomed concrete progress in their joint effort to develop energy, infrastructure, and digital connectivity in the region.  The two countries resolved to deepen and expand their partnership, whose major components include:Senior-level CoordinationEnergy Sector DevelopmentSustainable FinancingPrivate Sector Cooperation.  U.S. and Japanese private companies are cooperating on concrete projects in the Indo-Pacific region, including:Standards SettingNovember 13, 2018
Tokyo, Japan
